# Roleplay Rule 15 – Dangerous Equipment Must Be Used and Carried Appropriately
Prospect Sector allows players to use powerful tools, weapons, and dangerous equipment — **but only in the correct context**. Expeditions are hazardous, and players will naturally gear up before launching one. However, the **station interior** is a cooperative, civilian environment where openly carrying lethal gear harms RP and atmosphere.
## Core Principle - **Near the Terradrop machine, expedition prep zones, and staging areas:** Carrying visible dangerous gear is **expected and acceptable**.
- **Elsewhere on the station:** Dangerous or lethal equipment must be **stored away** (backpack, belt, locker, personal storage). Do not walk around the station visibly armed unless there is an active emergency.
## Dangerous Equipment Includes: - Expedition-tier weapons (ranged or melee) - High-risk tools or devices - Heavy engineering equipment that can cause major damage - Any gear designed mainly for combat or hazard neutralization
Normal work tools appropriate to your department **are not restricted**.
## Expectations for Command and Senior Roles Command and department heads must: - Model proper equipment etiquette - Encourage safe storage of dangerous gear - Prevent the station from becoming a “military base” environment - De-escalate improper open-carry situations through RP
They may authorize visible weapons **only during active emergencies** (fauna breach, reactor failure, hostile event).
## Examples
### Acceptable: - Carrying a visible weapon while waiting at the Terradrop for an upcoming expedition. - Wearing expedition armor during prep, testing gear, or loading supplies. - Temporarily drawing a weapon inside the station to respond to an immediate threat. - Storing weapons in personal storage before leaving the expedition zone.
### Prohibited: - Wandering around the bar, medbay, cargo, or hallways visibly armed without an emergency. - Keeping expedition weapons equipped while performing non-expedition duties. - Displaying dangerous devices or weapons in civilian areas for intimidation or spectacle. - Using “expedition roleplay” as an excuse to openly carry weapons everywhere.
## Roles expected to follow this closely: - Command roles (Station Lead, HoP, QM) - Department heads - Regular crew performing station-side duties - Expedition members when they are **not** at the expedition zone
## Roles with situational flexibility: - Expedition classes (Miner, Salvager, Explorer) **while near Terradrop** - Engineering or science roles transporting hazardous gear necessary for repairs/testing - Anyone during an admin-confirmed emergency event
## Final Note Expeditions are dangerous; the station is not. Bring your best gear **to the frontier**, not the cafeteria. Store dangerous equipment when moving away from the Terradrop zone to maintain RP quality and station safety.
